posts.post_content: Amazing with [Whip of Erebos](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Whip of Erebos); you play the demon, get at least four harpies, and then sac it to itself and bring it back with the whip (getting at least four more harpies). And it can still take an attack.

Posted By: WeeDragonuats (9/18/2013 6:35:05 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I always like Demon's that have a bonus and a drawback. Demons have always been affiliated with tempting offerings which later backfire. In this case, it just starts becoming a problem later.  
  
This will be a good limited creature since you get at least 2 1/1 flyers when it comes into play (that is, unless Devotion doesn't count it's own symbol count...). A 6/6 flyer is hard to deal with, no matter the limited environment.
posts.html:
I always like Demon's that have a bonus and a drawback. Demons have always been affiliated with tempting offerings which later backfire. In this case, it just starts becoming a problem later.

This will be a good limited creature since you get at least 2 1/1 flyers when it comes into play (that is, unless Devotion doesn't count it's own symbol count...). A 6/6 flyer is hard to deal with, no matter the limited environment.

Posted By: Ferlord (9/18/2013 7:05:46 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
@Ferlord:  
Devotion counts itself, as the ability triggers when the creature enters the battlefield. So the check for your devotion happens after the creature is already on the field, meaning you will always get at least 2 harpies with him.   
  
That said, in a vacuum, AO gives you 7 points of flying for your first attack, for 7 mana. Not bad for a black creature. Still in a vacuum, he kills himself after two swings, which is the cost of him being so efficient otherwise. Add a few more black mana symbols on your field, and he can get pretty crazy.   
  
I like him.
posts.html:
@Ferlord:
Devotion counts itself, as the ability triggers when the creature enters the battlefield. So the check for your devotion happens after the creature is already on the field, meaning you will always get at least 2 harpies with him.

That said, in a vacuum, AO gives you 7 points of flying for your first attack, for 7 mana. Not bad for a black creature. Still in a vacuum, he kills himself after two swings, which is the cost of him being so efficient otherwise. Add a few more black mana symbols on your field, and he can get pretty crazy.

I like him.

Posted By: PlanesMoyza (9/24/2013 11:23:45 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Solid card with a lot of great interactions in the set. My favourite: sacrifice it with [Rescue from the Underworld](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rescue from the Underworld) and reanimate anything with ETB triggers (especially any of the Devotion to black cards). Even if doing this doesn't allow you to dodge the beginning of upkeep trigger to sacrifice (I wasn't sure because [Rescue from the Underworld](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rescue from the Underworld) and this card both say "beginning of upkeep"), you get a bigger army (bonus points if you can give your guys haste).
posts.html:
Solid card with a lot of great interactions in the set. My favourite: sacrifice it with Rescue from the Underworld and reanimate anything with ETB triggers (especially any of the Devotion to black cards). Even if doing this doesn't allow you to dodge the beginning of upkeep trigger to sacrifice (I wasn't sure because Rescue from the Underworld and this card both say "beginning of upkeep"), you get a bigger army (bonus points if you can give your guys haste).
